How to connect to AWS EC2 ubuntu instance:

1. Open terminal
2. change directory to the directory where .pem file sits (in this case: cd Downloads/Website/)
3. type "ssh -i "CRS-FLASK-KP-1.pem" ubuntu@ec2-3-144-237-57.us-east-2.compute.amazonaws.com"
4. type "sudo apt-get update"
5. (Optional) type "sudo apt-get install python3-venv"
6. (Optional) make direcotry - type "mkdir your_directory_path"
7. Go to the directory where you wanna work in "cd crs_main/crs_main"
8.Â Initialize virtual environment for python: "python3 -m venv venv"
9. Launch virtual environment: "source venv/bin/activate"
10. Install necessary python packages: "pip install -------"
    10.1 pandas, numpy, bs4, mysql-connector-python, statsmodels, matplotlib, seaborn, flask_sqlalchemy
    10.2 Flask, joblib, wheel, mysql, requests, flask-login
    10.3 sklearn, xgboost..... etc
11. If you ever need to create an app for your self, then type this to make the file: "sudo nano -----.py"
12. check the vim interface command languages to modify, save, discard and etc
13. To check if the app is running fine, just type "python app.py" and see if it works from the public IPv4 domain
14. Check if the gunicorn is working: "gunicorn -b 0.0.0.0:8080 app:app"
15. Go to "cd /etc/systemd/system"
16. "sudo nano crs_main.service" and make sure following is there:


**MYSQL AWS RDS db password: Rkdrmsdn0831

[Unit]
Description=Gunicorn instance to serve crs_main
After=network.target

[Service]
User=ubuntu
Group=www-data
WorkingDirectory=/home/ubuntu/crs_main/crs_main
ExecStart=/home/ubuntu/crs_main/crs_main/venv/bin/gunicorn -b localhost:8080 app:app
Restart=always

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target

17. then type: "sudo systemctl daemon-reload"
18. then type: "sudo systemctl start crs_main" (which is same name as ----.service file)
19. then type: "sudo systemctl enable crs_main"
20. then type: "curl localhost:8080"
